meta.title: Examples & Tutorials - Semantic Self-Aware Kit
meta.description: Practical implementation examples and use cases

content_blocks.content:
🎯 Examples & Tutorials

Practical implementation examples and use cases

🚀 Quick Start Example

The simplest way to get started with the Semantic Self-Aware Kit using the framework startup approach. 


# Basic framework initialization
from semantic_self_aware_kit import SemanticFramework

# Initialize the complete framework
framework = SemanticFramework()
await framework.startup()

# The framework is now ready with all components
print(f"Framework initialized with {len(framework.components)} components")

What This Does

  • • Initializes all 15+ framework components
  • • Sets up collaboration protocols
  • • Establishes monitoring and security
  • • Enables uncertainty analysis

📦 Component Usage Examples

🧠 Meta-Cognitive Evaluation


# Self-awareness assessment
evaluator = framework.meta_cognitive
results = await evaluator.evaluate(
    target_system=my_system,
    max_depth=3
)

print(f"Self-awareness score: {results.score}")
print(f"Bias detected: {results.bias_detected}")

Evaluates AI system self-awareness with bias detection and recursive analysis.

📊 Performance Analysis


# Comprehensive benchmarking
analyzer = framework.performance
benchmark = await analyzer.benchmark(
    target_system=my_system,
    tests=["speed", "reliability", "quality"]
)

print(f"Speed improvement: {benchmark.speed_gain}%")
print(f"Reliability score: {benchmark.reliability}")

Tests the three built-in falsifiable hypotheses with empirical validation.

🎯 Advanced Uncertainty Analysis


# Multi-dimensional uncertainty assessment
from semantic_self_aware_kit.advanced_uncertainty import create_advanced_uncertainty_analyzer

analyzer = create_advanced_uncertainty_analyzer()
assessment = analyzer.assess_uncertainty(
    target="microservices_decision",
    context={
        "complexity": "high",
        "timeline": "tight",
        "resources": "limited"
    }
)

print(f"Overall uncertainty: {assessment.overall_uncertainty}")
print(f"Risk score: {assessment.risk_score}")

Assesses uncertainty across 7 dimensions with detailed risk analysis.

🤝 Advanced Collaboration


# AI partnership establishment
from semantic_self_aware_kit.advanced_collaboration import AdvancedPartnershipEngine

partnership_engine = AdvancedPartnershipEngine("my_ai")
partnership = await partnership_engine.establish_partnership("collaborator_ai")

task_id = await partnership_engine.assign_collaborative_task(
    description="Analyze and refactor authentication module",
    complexity="medium",
    required_expertise=["security", "python"]
)

print(f"Task assigned with ID: {task_id}")

Establishes AI partnerships and coordinates collaborative tasks.

💻 CLI Usage Examples

Basic CLI Commands


# Get intelligent suggestions
semantic-kit suggest

# Test self-awareness
semantic-kit self-test

# List all components
semantic-kit list-components

# Run performance benchmarks
semantic-kit benchmark

Advanced CLI Commands


# Run metacognitive cascade on a decision
semantic-kit cascade "Should we implement microservices?"

# Deep investigation of code
semantic-kit investigate ./src/core_module

# Demonstrate framework capabilities
semantic-kit demo

# Test all components
semantic-kit test-all

🐍 Programmatic Examples

🧪 Empirica Wrapper Usage


# Using the Empirica wrapper (alternative naming)
import empirica

# Initialize with Empirica naming
evaluator = empirica.EmpiricaEvaluator()
analyzer = empirica.EmpiricaCodeAnalyzer("./my_project")
tool_manager = empirica.EmpiricaToolManager()

# Use components with familiar interface
results = await evaluator.hybrid_evaluate("my_reasoning_process")
analysis = analyzer.comprehensive_analysis()

The Empirica wrapper provides alternative naming while maintaining full functionality.

🔍 Code Intelligence Analysis


# Deep code analysis and improvement
from semantic_self_aware_kit.code_intelligence_analyzer import CodeIntelligenceAnalyzer

analyzer = CodeIntelligenceAnalyzer("./my_project")
results = analyzer.comprehensive_analysis()

print(f"Files analyzed: {results['metadata']['total_artifacts']}")
print(f"Recommendations: {results['synthesis']['key_recommendations']}")

# Generate a detailed report
report = analyzer.generate_report("analysis_report.md")

Performs AI archaeology and semantic analysis of codebases.
